so_7489453: curl --data-urlencode @file http://example.com

POST / HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: curl/7.19.5 (i486-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.19.5 OpenSSL/0.9.8g zlib/1.2.3.3 libidn/1.15
Host: example.com
Accept: */*
Content-Length: 90
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

00%3A0f%3A1f%3A64%3A7d%3Aff%0A00%3A0f%3A1f%3A64%3A7d%3Aff%0A00%3A0f%3A1f%3A64%3A7d%3Aff%0A

curl -F MACS=@file http://example.com

curl -F MACS=<file http://example.com

Explanations about Options.-v:
Makes curl verbose during the operation. Useful for debugging and seeing what's
 going on "under the hood". A line starting with '>' means "header data" sent by
 curl, '<' means "header data" received by curl that is hidden in normal cases, and
 a line starting with '*' means additional info provided by curl.
Explanations about Options.-F:
(HTTP SMTP IMAP) For HTTP protocol family, this lets curl emulate a filled-in form
 in which a user has pressed the submit button. This causes curl to POST data using
 the Content-Type multipart/form-data according to RFC 2388.

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Connect to a remote server using a specific port
Top-3 Similar Questions: so_21942342: Execute a php file using curl
so_53285645: How to use CURL over SSH and get the file as well as the return value?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_53285645: #!/bin/bash

CONTENT=$(sshpass -p xxxxxx ssh root@172.17.1.33 "curl -X POST http://127.0.0.1:10000/status -H 'Content-Type: application/json'")

RETURN=$?

echo "$RETURN, $CONTENT"

Explanations about Options.-X:
Enables X11 forwarding. This can also be specified on a per-host basis in a
 configuration file.

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Capture all TCP traffic showing contents (ASCII) in console
Top-3 Scripts:
so_14215188: tcpdump -A -s 1600 host some.site.at.somwhere.com and port 80

tcpdump -w http-traffic.pcap -s 1600 host some.site.at.somwhere.com and port 80

Explanations about Options.-w:
Write the raw packets to file rather than parsing and printing them out. They can
 later be printed with the -r option. Standard output is used if file is ``-''.
